description: Application under Section 73(A) to vary Conditions 2 (Approved Plans) 21 (Car Park Management Plan) and 22 (Green Travel Plan) of planning permission 15/12936/FUL (Demolition of existing outbuildings, alterations and part demolition of main two storey building. Use of existing building and site as secondary school and erection of three storey rear extension to provide 6537sqm of additional floorspace for classrooms, etc. and sports hall accommodation for six forms of entry for seven year groups. Provision of Multi-Use Games Area to rear and enclosures to front and rear to provide outside space associated with the school. Provision of widened pedestrian/ cycle access route between Wolsey Drive and Richmond Road and alterations to the front car park to provide a total of 82 parking spaces and provision of cycle parking.) to formalise the absence of a vehicle drop-off arrangement on the school site
decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate beyond the balance of probabilities that the permanent removal of the on-site vehicular drop off facility and changes to the level and nature of car parking provision would not have an unacceptable adverse impact upon highway safety and that the proposed development would not result in "severe" residual impacts on the local highway network, thereby conflicting with Paragraph 109 of the NPPF, 2019 and policies DM9 ad DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012.

Your attention is drawn to the fact that planning permission does not override property rights and any ancient rights of light that may exist. This permission does not empower you to enter onto land not in your ownership without the specific consent of the owner. If you require further information or advice, you should consult a solicitor.
Please amend the application form to reflect the correct site as the property is to rear of 26 & 28 Kinghts Park, Kingston. Please confirm.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The tree is host to a large bracket of Ganoderma and due to it's age an dthe state of decay needs to be maintained with care and sympathy. The works proposed do just this by reducing the wind loading both in canopy size and density.Recommendation:Approve.
